title: Add Overlay UI like Android
body:
The new Notification access is awesome but is it possible to add Overlay UI and " Services " ( you will find it under accessibility settings in Android) to RS2. It will make UWP more powerful like win32 and also let dev make some powerful and useful apps like " Universal Copy " and 'Native Clipboard" . I am adding some screenshots too. You can install those Android apps yourself. Screenshot_2016-06-12-11-02-35.png http://i.imgur.com/bpHQXue.png

comments.body:
Rather would have the platform itself be improved as most of those android services try to fill holes in android, but worse they also open dozen more in the end. (most of those have security leaks).
The overlay UI has always been a thing that annoyed me and isn't really used a lot, in fact most the use has been declining over time.
Should either be allowed in the future then Microsoft should demand some full test coverage in areas of security and privacy.
